intro: Linum humile subsp. transiens, commonly known as the Transient Meadow Flax, is a low-growing perennial herb native to parts of Europe and western Asia. It typically reaches a height of 10–30 cm and produces small, blue to purple flowers that bloom in early summer. The plant has slender, branching stems and narrow, grass-like leaves. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed sites. Its flowers attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies, contributing to its ecological significance.
